div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, September 29, 1915

NEW YORK
September 29, 1915
Dear Dr Carter:
div1.p:
I wish to thank you for the malaria leaflet. You
have made an effective beginning toward the education of
the people of these Southern states on the subject of
malaria.

I have read your article with keen interest and am
returning your copy of the American Journal of Tropical
Diseases.

I wish I had opportunity to hear all your questions
about the proposed work in malaria which we discussed
Monday morning. I desire especially to have the full
benefit of your thought concerning all these details.
When I go to Washington again I shall undertake to arrange
to stop over in Baltimore to give myself this opportunity.

The purpose which I hope to accomplish by this pro-
posed undertaking is, as stated in the paper which I gave
you, to try out various methods and their combinations in
order to see what degree of malaria control we may be able
to achieve under average conditions in the rural communities
of the South; to discover the most effective methods for
H R C - 2
achieving this control; and to find out the cost of the
work. This is the purpose in both the first and the second
undertakings as outlined. I do not want to content myself
with trying out this first plan alone. I have found that
an experiment which fails at one point may succeed at
another point even when we are trying to carry out the same
measures in both places. When we were going through the
experimental stage of the community work in the Southern
states we tried this experiment in different states and
under different conditions. So in this first undertaking
in malaria control it has seemed to me advisable to try
it out at more than one point and under more than one set
of conditions and to try out more than one measure or com-
binations of measures. It is hoped that this effort which
is experimental in the beginning will finally lead to a type
of work which we may adopt with considerable confidence in
its efficiency.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours Wickliffe Rose. Dr H R Carter
U S Marine Hospital
Baltimore, Maryland
